articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hyon Yong Ra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hyon Yong Ra
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of Prof. and Dr. Hyon Yong Ra, a researcher of the Nonferrous Metal Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and Labor Hero, on Saturday expressing deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to PM of Grenada
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to PM of Grenada
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of sympathy on Sept. 15 to Keith Mitchell, prime minister of Grenada and president of the Caribbean Community, as regards the recent hurricane that caused big casualties and huge material losses in Grenada and other Caribbean countries.
					 The message expressed belief that Grenada and other Caribbean countries would eradicate damage and bring the life of the people in the afflicted areas to normal as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Meets Leading Members of ITF
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Meets Leading Members of ITF
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had talks with Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, and other leading members of the ITF who are taking part in the 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships at the Taekwon-Do Hall Sunday.

articles.title: 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships Opens
articles.content:
20th World Taekwon-Do Championships Opens
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships opened with due ceremony on Sunday here.
					 Participating in the championships were players and delegations from 69 countries and regions of the world.
					
					 Citizens in Pyongyang and sportspersons warmly welcomed the participants along the route.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee who is chairman of the organizational committee of the championships, officials concerned and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Attending it were Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, executive members of the ITF, representatives from national associations under the ITF and diplomatic envoys of different countries and members of international bodies here and other foreign guests.
					
					 Taekwon-Do teams of the DPRK, Russia, Mongolia, England and other countries and referees entered the venue of the opening ceremony.
					
					 Kim Kyong Ho in his opening address expressed thanks to the participants for their positive support before congratulatory speeches.
					
					 Pak Pong Ju hoped that the participants would promote concord and unity and enjoy pleasant and happy days during the championships.
					
					 Ri Yong Son expressed belief that the participants would display their high techniques and noble mental and moral traits and fully show the advantages and power of the orthodox Taekwon-Do.
					
					 The Taekwon-Do players made a pledge and a performance was given in congratulation of the championships.

articles.title: 26th ITF General Meeting Held
articles.content:
26th ITF General Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The 26th general meeting of the International Taekwon-Do Federation took place here on Sunday.
					 Present there were Ri Yong Son, president of the International Taekwon-Do Federation and chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, executive members of the ITF, representatives from the national associations under the ITF and officials concerned.
					
					 Coaches of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee took part in the meeting as observers.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the ITF work since its 25th general meeting and decided on host countries for the 13th Juvenile and 8th Veteran Taekwon-Do Championships in 2018 and the 21st World Taekwon-Do Championships in 2019. It also adopted relevant documents including amended rules of the ITF and regulations of the game.

articles.title: DPRK's Doctorate in Sports Science Conferred on Chairman of Indian Taekwon-Do Association
articles.content:
DPRK's Doctorate in Sports Science Conferred on Chairman of Indian Taekwon-Do Association
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The doctorate in sports science of the DPRK was conferred on Rajendran Balan, chairman of the Indian Association of Taekwon-Do.
					 He contributed to strengthening the Federation and developing Taekwon-do techniques.
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture Sunday.

articles.title: Students and Youth in Pyongyang Tour Oun Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Students and Youth in Pyongyang Tour Oun Revolutionary Site
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Students and youths in Pyongyang made a study tour of the Oun Revolutionary Site Sunday to mark the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's participation in the military camping drill there.
					 They laid a floral basket and bunches of flowers before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at Kim Il Sung University and paid tribute to them.
					
					 There took place a kick-off meeting.
					
					 Present there were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and minister of Higher Education, officials of the youth league and members of the expedition.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the C.C., the youth league, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 At the end of the meeting, they started their march toward the Oun Revolutionary Site.
					
					 During the march, they had a poem-recital and a contest of singing in chorus which showed vividly showed the great personality of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 After arrival at their destination, the marchers were briefed on the revolutionary site and looked round historic materials and buildings.

articles.title: Art Performance Goes on in Wonsan of DPRK
articles.content:
Art Performance Goes on in Wonsan of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- A music and dance performance by the Moranbong Band, the State Merited Chorus and the Wangjaesan Art Troupe is still going on before full houses in Wonsan City of Kangwon Province.
					 The Songdowon Youth Open-Air Theatre, a place of performance, is crowed with inhabitants of various strata from cities and counties in the province every day.
					
					 The performance well represents the greatness of the Workers' Party of Korea which has made a history of people-first principle, scoring only proud victories under the wise and tested leadership of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu.
					
					 And it impressively shows the noble ideological and moral world of the Kangwon provincial inhabitants who proved in practice the vitality of the self-development-first principle by devotedly implementing the behests of the leader and the Party's line and policy.
					
					 The performance also deals with the great traits of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un who is translating into reality the peoples' ideal and dreams with his warm love and devotion.
					
					 It is creating a great sensation among the audience and other residents in the province.

articles.title: Exhibition of Fishing Tackle Inventions
articles.content:
Exhibition of Fishing Tackle Inventions
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of fishing tackle inventions recently took place on the bank of the River Pothong in Pyongyang after the 15th national angling contest.
					 On display there were more than 2 370 inventions of 280-odd kinds presented by the provincial, city and county associations of angling fans.
					
					 The associations of angling fans in Kangwon Province and other coastal provinces exhibited tackles effective in catching gizzard shad, codfish, squid, mackerel, flatfish and other sea fishes.
					
					 Among exhibits which drew attention of visitors were an umbrella-shaped hat presented by South Hamgyong Province and an automatic tool for jerking hook by Nampho City.
					
					 Ri Myong Won, section chief of the Korean Association of Angling Fans, told KCNA that all the exhibits showed the wisdom and efforts of fans, adding that the exhibition came to be a good occasion in exchanging experience and knacks.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Praises Kim Jong Un as Brilliant Commander of Songun
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Praises Kim Jong Un as Brilliant Commander of Songun
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un is the peerless patriot and outstanding great man who has put the country's dignity and national power on the highest stage and ushered in a bright road of the nation with his unremitting patriotic devotion, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Today the DPRK has emerged a nuclear power of Juche thanks to his outstanding and tested leadership and his devotion day and night and this is a historic event.
					
					 He paved an untrodden path of bolstering up the nuclear force, cherishing deep the noble mission for the destiny of the country and people left by the great leaders.
					
					 He has resolutely defeated the challenges of the enemies and led the drive of bolstering the state nuclear force with the iron will to put an end to the U.S. brigandish hostile policy and moves for war of aggression.
					
					 The DPRK achieved great victories in "March 18 revolution," which declared the birth of the Juche-oriented rocket industry, "July 4 revolution", July 28 event, medium-to-long range rocket launching drill, the perfect success in the ICBM-ready H-bomb test and the recent medium-to-long range rocket fire drill. These are brilliant fruition of the energetic leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK, who are rallied closely around him, will achieve the final victory in the showdown with the U.S.-led imperialists.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling U.S. Sanctions by Dint of Self-Reliance
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Foiling U.S. Sanctions by Dint of Self-Reliance
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK will continue to foil the racket for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK kicked up by the U.S. and its hand-raising machines with the might of self-reliance, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 The spirit of self-reliance and self-development has turned the Korean people into those strongest in mental power who think there is nothing impossible, and the country into an invincible power no one can ever look down upon, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 It is the pride of Korea matchless with other countries that it started the un-trodden path of revolution in the spirit of independence and created the ever-victorious history and tradition with the might of single-minded unity and self-reliance.
					
					 The epoch-making changes and great victories won by the DPRK through stern and gigantic struggle eloquently prove that nothing can stop its people advancing along the road of self-reliance under the uplifted banner of self-development-first spirit.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK are well aware of why they have to turn out in the arduous road of do-or-die struggle and why they have to certainly emerge victors in this road.
					
					 No one is going to help us and no one wishes our country getting stronger and getting better-off. The only way for glorifying the dignity and honor of the independent people won at the cost of blood is self-development. We will continue to keep to this path and will certainly win a final victory in the confrontation with the U.S. This is the determination of the Korean army and people.
					
					 Herein lies the invincible might of Juche Korea shattering to pieces any sanctions and pressure racket of the U.S. and its vassal forces.

articles.title: Japan's Security Depends on Its Attitude: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Japan's Security Depends on Its Attitude: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries came under fire by Minju Joson, a leading newspaper of the DPRK, Sunday for going mischievous, describing the measures taken by the DPRK for self-defense as "threats" to peace and their security.
					 The chief executive and other riff-raffs of Japan assert that north Korea's deed should not be allowed, calling on the international community to tighten pressure on it.
					
					 Commenting on the facts, the paper says the recent military actions taken by the DPRK were just steps for self-defence to defend the sovereignty of the country and the security of the people from the U.S. isolation moves.
					
					 The DPRK had access to a nuclear force to end the aggressive nuclear threat from the U.S. However, the Japanese reactionaries assert that it poses "threat" to Japan's security. This far-fetched assertion can not be construed otherwise than an anti-DPRK provocation, the paper says, and continues:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries seek to secure a pretext for realizing their ambition for turning their country into a military giant and create a favorable condition for militarist overseas expansion by rendering the theory of "threats" and "provocation" from the DPRK extremely dangerous.
					
					 It is the unanimous will of the army and people of the DPRK to smash the Japanese reactionaries keen on meeting their own interests by sacrificing the interests of the Korean nation.
					
					 Japan had better be careful in words, mindful that it is no problem for the DPRK to teach Japan a serious lesson as it has even the U.S. within its striking range.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Derides S. Korean Puppet Forces as Pro-U.S. Stooges
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Derides S. Korean Puppet Forces as Pro-U.S. Stooges
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The authorities of south Korea including the Chongwadae and the foreign and defense ministries vociferated about "strong will of the international community" and "tightened level of sanctions" after the U.S. cooked up another anti-DPRK "sanctions resolution" by mobilizing the hand-raising machines at the UN Security Council. They are getting clamorous, talking about "massive effect of pressure" and "strong pains" and giving impression that something big will happen following the "sanctions resolution".
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a commentary ridicules the south Korean authorities, who had been dumb-founded at the nuclear test of the DPRK, for "supporting and welcoming" the UN "sanctions resolution".
					
					 This despicable act is just the last-ditch effort of the colonial stooges to delay the final doom of its master, the paper notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. whom south Korea looks up to as its master is having a hard time for having gone helter-skelter without knowledge of the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces are finding fault with the U.S.-targeted step taken by the DPRK for self-defense as if a bomb exploded in its land. They are truly senseless traitors serving the U.S.
					
					 The colonial stooges talk rubbish, nothing surprising to the DPRK, even though they depend on the master and read the face of the master to prolong their days.
					
					 They should behave with reason, paying heed to the warning of the DPRK that their reckless rubbish about "sanctions" and "pressure" would lead them to an end in a moment.

articles.title: Maltreatment of Children on Increase in S. Korea
articles.content:
Maltreatment of Children on Increase in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Maltreatment of children is increasing in south Korea, becoming a serious social issue, according to the south Korean CBS.
					 According to data of the puppet Ministry of Justice, the number of maltreatment of children last year rose up 70 percent as against the previous year, 18 times-increase in four years.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed by Regional Body
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed by Regional Body
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Marwan Sudah, chairman of the Arab Committee for Solidarity with Korean People and Supporting the Reunification of Korea, issued a statement on September 9, the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The statement lauded President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for their exploits performed in founding and strengthening the DPRK.
					
					 It described the DPRK's recent ICBM-ready H-bomb test as a great success of the Korean people staunchly struggling against the U.S. highhandedness and as a signal event which will go down forever in the Korean nation's history of 5000 years.
					
					 Shortly ago, the DPRK succeeded in its ICBM launching test again and thus strikingly showed that it is an independent and sovereign state of Juche and a world military giant, it said.
					
					 Noting that respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un proved once again the validity of the Juche idea and the Songun politics through the recent successful H-bomb test, the statement stressed that he would lead the DPRK to a fresh victory.

articles.title: DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed in Bangladesh
articles.content:
DPRK's Successful H-bomb Test Hailed in Bangladesh
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Jatiya Party, Bangladesh People's League, Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee issued a joint statement on September 5 to celebrate the DPRK's successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test.
					 The statement said:
					
					 We extend warm congratulations to the Workers' Party of Korea and the heroic Korean people on the DPRK's complete success in the test of H-bomb for ICBM.
					
					 The successful test further cemented the strategic position of the DPRK and demonstrated once again before the world the indomitable mettle and spirit of the Korean people who are advancing, resolutely smashing the imperialists' violent moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. should recognize that its reckless hostile policy and nuclear threat compelled the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear force and should roll back the anachronistic policy which would drive the U.S. mainland to nuclear disaster.
					
					 The progressive people of Bangladesh extend firm support and solidarity to the struggle of the WPK and the Korean people that are pushing ahead the building of a socialist power despite the vicious moves of the hostile forces.

articles.title: DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed in DR Congo
articles.content:
DPRK's H-bomb Test Hailed in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The detonation of the DPRK's H-bomb, which jolted the world, is a stern sentence upon the U.S. imperialists.
					 Jimmy Kikoni, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Democratic Congo, said this in a statement on September 6.
					
					 The successful ICBM-ready H-bomb test is a historic event that threw the U.S. which acts arrogantly, calling for sanctions and pressure against the DPRK, into the downhill of ruin, the statement said, adding:
					
					 If the U.S. continues to act foolishly, failing to understand the might and strategic position of Juche Korea growing with passage of time, its remaining days will be shorter.
					
					 Nobody can stop the vigorous advance of the Korean people for attaining the final goal for the state nuclear force.
					
					 Through the DPRK's appearance, the world clearly witnessed that only the spirit of self-reliance and self-development serves as the source of power for registering the best success even under the worst condition.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Nepal
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Nepal
 Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- The full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "Answers to the Questions Raised by the U.S. Washington Times Press Corps" was carried by a Nepalese newspaper on September 4 ahead of the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The paper carried a photo of the smiling President.
					
					 The work, published on April 12, Juche 81 (1992), contains the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government's stand on the nuclear issue and inter-Korean relations and the DPRK-U.S. relations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunta Hyon Yong Ra
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Hyon Yong Ra
Pyongyang, September 17 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a wreath to the bier of Prof. and Dr. Hyon Yong Ra, a researcher of the Nonferrous Metal Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and Labor Hero, on Saturday expressing deep condolences over her death.
